references.paper_title: Physics-informed neural networks: A deep learning framework for solving forward and inverse problems involving nonlinear partial differential equations
references.reason: This paper introduces the foundational Physics-Informed Neural Network (PINN) framework, which is the core methodology analyzed throughout the current research.

references.paper_title: Gradient descent finds the global optima of two-layer physics-informed neural networks
references.reason: This paper provides the initial theoretical analysis of PINN convergence, which the current work expands upon to address higher-order PDEs.

references.paper_title: Understanding and mitigating gradient flow pathologies in physics-informed neural networks
references.reason: This paper addresses the known convergence challenges of PINNs, particularly with higher-order PDEs, which directly motivates the current research's focus on variable splitting.

references.paper_title: An operator preconditioning perspective on training in physics-informed machine learning
references.reason: This paper offers a novel perspective on PINN training using operator preconditioning, which offers potential synergistic improvements when combined with the variable splitting approach discussed in the current research.

references.paper_title: Beyond derivative pathology of PINNs: Variable splitting strategy with convergence analysis
references.reason: This paper is a previous work of the authors that introduces the variable splitting strategy that improves the convergence of PINNs, which is the main focus of the current research.
